result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabriel P Rodriguez

records.addlTxt: email dated 9/1/2022 from Corporation Counsel regarding the discharge of defendant Gabriel Rodriguez scanned in to the record.

Defendant Gabriel P Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Gabriel P Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Lisa Procaccio appeared as a friend of the court for Corporation Counsel.
Parties review report dated 08-12-22 submitted by Dr. DeBoer. State does not challenge the report.  Defendant does not wish to challenge the report.  Parties stipulate that the Court may use the Doctor's Report as a factual basis.  Based upon the forensic evaluations filed with the Court and the record before it, having determined pursuant to 971.147, Wis. Stats., the Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to stand trial and is not likely to regain competency within the remaining commitment period under Chapter 971.  Upon Petition for Conversion filed by the Assistant District Attorney, Court orders the proceedings converted to proceedings under Ch. 51, Stats., and the criminal complaint, statements of witnesses, transcripts and forensic evaluation reports shall serve as a law enforcement officer's statement of detention under Chapter 51, Stats.  Court further ordered the criminal proceedings suspended and defendant REMANDED to the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff, who shall FORTHWITH convey defendant to the Behavioral Health Division "BHD", where defendant shall be held for proceedings under Chapter 51, Stats., where he shall receive a psychiatric evaluation within 24 hours of admission to determine whether he is a proper subject for commitment under Ch. 51.

Order of Conversion to Civil Commitment Proceedings Under 971.14(6)(b) Wis. Stats., signed at 2:35pm, filed and distributed.

Defendant Gabriel P Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Gabriel P Rodriguez.  Attorney Nate McClure in court for State of Wisconsin.  For reasons stated on the record, case adjourned to the afternoon calendar.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gabriel P Rodriguez in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Gabriel P Rodriguez in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court with 21CM4164.  Matter remains calendared in Branch 13.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Gabriel P Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for competency hearing. Defendant refused to appear for a third time. Court proceeded with the hearing. Parties in receipt of examiner's report. State does not challenge Dr. DeBoer's report.  Defendant does challenge Dr. DeBoer's report.  Parties stipulate to Dr. DeBoer's qualifications to testify as an expert. Sworn for the State: Dr. DeBoer. Testimony closed.  Arguments heard. After review of all evidence, report and testimony of Dr. DeBoer, Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense. Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame. Order of Commitment signed and filed. Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility FORTHWITH. 
Court orders case adjourned back to Branch 37 for Competency Review Hearing.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Gabriel P Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant refused to leave his cell for today's hearing.  Attorney Fuentes has not been able to review the doctor's report with defendant due to defendant's lack of cooperation.  Court finds that defendant stands mute as to the report.  State does not challenge the report.  Matter adjourned for a competency hearing in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Gabriel P Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant refused to leave his cell in the jail.  Report from forensics informed the court that defendant did not cooperate with Forensics as to his competency evaluation.  Court made a finding that it is defense intent to raise competency on defendant's companion cases 221CM4164, 22CM141 and 22CM403, Court REMANDED the defendant FORTHWITH to DHS custody to allow for his compentency evaluation.  No objections from parties.  Matter remains calendared in Branch 37.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; RODRIGUEZ REPORT

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Gabriel P Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a return on doctor's report. Court is in receipt of a request for an extension from Dr. Neiss. Court grants request, defendant's REMAND remains in full effect. Case remains calendared in Br. 37.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
dated 3/22/2022 from Dr. Niess requesting an extension to file her doctor's report to April 1, 2022, received and filed

Defendant Gabriel P Rodriguez in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Gabriel P Rodriguez in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gabriel P Rodriguez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 17.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
